title: How an Attack on a Synagogue in Manchester Unfolded
summary: A congregant in Manchester, England, described how fellow worshipers, including the rabbi, used their bodies to barricade the entrance as the assailant tried to force his way in.

title: Police Accidentally Shot and Killed a Victim During Manchester Terrorist Attack
summary: Officials said one of the men killed at the Heaton Park Congregation synagogue in northwestern England had been hit by police gunfire.

title: Trump Escalates Attacks on Democrats in a Government Shutdown Like No Other
summary: Shutdowns are always unpleasant affairs. But President Trump has used his power in aggressive and strikingly personal ways.

title: ‘A Hornet’s Nest:’ Mamdani’s Gifted Education Plan Divides New Yorkers
summary: Zohran Mamdani wants to phase out the city’s gifted program for kindergarten students if elected, a proposal that drew intense criticism and praise.

title: 140,000 N.Y.C. Students Are Homeless. Can the Next Mayor Change That?
summary: The city’s housing crisis has contributed to an education crisis, with more children than ever living in temporary housing. They face dismal outcomes.

title: On ‘The Life of a Showgirl,’ Taylor Swift Has a Lust for Love (and Her Foes)
summary: On her 12th original album, the pop superstar sounds hungry to embrace her future — but not until she attends to some unfinished business.

title: Taylor Swift Wears Bob Mackie’s Bejeweled Designs for ‘Life of a Showgirl’
summary: Bob Mackie, whose bejeweled designs have appeared on a list of performers that now includes the singer, reflects on a role he has dressed many for.

title: Why Are H-1B Visas Suddenly a Big Deal? One Reason: Tech Jobs Disappeared
summary: The president’s decision to charge employers $100,000 per visa for skilled workers seemed to come out of nowhere. But the grievance behind it has been simmering.

title: Trump Administration Reverses $187 Million in N.Y. Counterterrorism Cuts
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul had said the cuts, which would have devastated New York’s intelligence and counterterrorism operations, made “all of America more vulnerable to terrorist attacks.”

title: After Declining to Give Trump a Sword for King Charles, a Museum Leader Is Out
summary: The departure of Todd Arrington, who led the Dwight D. Eisenhower Presidential Library and Museum, came after the administration sought a sword from its collection as a gift for King Charles.

title: Trump Administration Suspends $2.1 Billion in Funding for Chicago Transit Projects
summary: The money had been designated to modernize the city’s “L” trains. Illinois officials condemned the move, saying it was motivated by political revenge.

title: Trump Sets Sunday Deadline for Hamas to Agree to Cease-fire Plan With Israel
summary: President Trump said Hamas would be “extinguished” if it did not agree to a cease-fire proposed by the United States.

title: Hamas Looks to Avoid ‘Take It or Leave It’ on Trump Proposal
summary: A senior member of the Palestinian group said that the group would soon announce its position on President Trump’s plan to end the war in Gaza.

title: My Reporting Led to a Landmark Lawsuit. The Case Took 22 Years.
summary: A class-action lawsuit, spurred by an investigative series in The Times, came to a close, having helped thousands of mentally ill residents of adult homes.

title: How Jane Goodall’s Death Launched Netflix’s New ‘Famous Last Words’ Series
summary: An interview with the conservationist is the first in a new series, “Famous Last Words.” More episodes are in the vault, their subjects unknown, for now.

title: Pete Hegseth, Trump and an Era of Military Impunity
summary: Pete Hegseth’s advocacy for service members accused of war crimes, and Trump’s pardons of them, have helped usher in an era of military aggression and disregard for the rule of law.

title: Inside the U.S. Special Forces: 5 Takeaways on a Culture of Lawlessness in Afghanistan
summary: Until now, many of the troubling events that took place during the war in Afghanistan have been shrouded in secrecy.

title: Indian Comedian Kunal Kamra Forced Offstage Amid Political Censorship
summary: The Indian comedian Kunal Kamra was forced offstage after a political joke led to a mob attack. Unlike Jimmy Kimmel, he is unlikely to return anytime soon.

title: Jane Fonda Revives Her Father’s McCarthy-Era Free Speech Group
summary: The actress joined Spike Lee, Billie Eilish, Pedro Pascal and others in reviving the Committee for the First Amendment, a group that her father, Henry Fonda, was a member of in the 1940s.

title: The East Wing Ballroom is Trump’s Raw Display of Power
summary: The president is refashioning his residence into a palace. Our democracy is now a members-only club.

title: A Breath of Fresh Air With Brian Eno
summary: The musician and record producer Brian Eno delves into his experiments with ambient music, his thoughts on generative A.I. and his deep gratitude for the uniqueness of human life.

title: President Trump’s War on Cartels
summary: Plus, we’re covering the government shutdown.

title: Putin Suggests Trump Will Decide Against Sending Tomahawk Missiles to Ukraine
summary: The Russian president warned against fulfilling a Ukrainian request for more powerful long-range missiles, while also suggesting President Trump would decide against the idea.

title: Patricia Routledge, Hoity-Toity Housewife of ‘Keeping Up Appearances,’ Dies at 96
summary: Before she became known as the snooty suburbanite Hyacinth Bucket, Ms. Routledge was an acclaimed stage performer, appearing with the Royal Shakespeare Company and on the West End and Broadway.

title: Body Camera Video Shows Police Confronting Michigan Church Gunman
summary: In the newly released video, two officers can be seen outside of the Latter-day Saints church, along with a bystander holding a handgun. The shooter died in an exchange of gunfire.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to Hawaii Law Limiting Guns on Private Property
summary: The Second Amendment case involves a Hawaii law that generally prohibits firearms on private property that is accessible to the public.
